name: Attestation Overview
content: Understanding the concept and role of attestation in digital

steps.name: Attestation Role
steps.content: Attestations are crucial in representing trust and identity in digital interactions. They are fundamental components of decentralized identity systems. These attestations help create a comprehensive picture of an entity's identity as they can both receive and issue attestations about themselves.

steps.name: Ecosystem Fragmentation
steps.content: The development of numerous identity protocols has led to fragmentation in the ecosystem. This fragmentation makes it challenging for developers to create a comprehensive view of digital identity. Identity can be represented as an aggregate of attestations made by various entities over time.

steps.name: EAS Introduction
steps.content: Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS) is an open-source infrastructure designed to provide a public good for creating attestations. It is intended to serve as a foundational layer for various applications and use cases, offering flexibility for developers to choose the most suitable approach for their specific needs.

steps.name: EAS Tools
steps.content: EAS provides an SDK and a set of developer tools to simplify the process of working with attestations. This makes it easier for developers to integrate EAS into their projects. The focus of EAS is on providing a service to the community rather than generating revenue from the infrastructure itself.

steps.name: EAS Contracts
steps.content: EAS includes a contract that allows users to register structured data about various topics. This serves as a way to define and categorize the types of data that can be attested to within the EAS ecosystem. Another contract enables the creation of attestations based on the registered schemas.
